discussion.p: I just noticed that the following program is legal in C++03, but is forbidden in the current draft:
Is this change intentional? (And if so, what is the justification? I wouldn't call such code good, but I don't see any reason to break it unless we get something else in return.)
discussion.blockquote: The subgroup that looked at this felt this was a good change, but it may already be handled by incoming concepts (we're not sure).

blockquote.p: Alisdair: Proposed resolution kinda funky as these tables no longer exist. Move from direct init to copy init. Clarify with Doug, recommends NAD.
Walter: Suggest NAD via introduction of concepts.

discussion.blockquote: Need to look at again without concepts.

blockquote.p: Move to Ready with original proposed resolution.

discussion.p: This issue was re-reviewed in relation to [another issue, number to follow], and the verdict was reversed. Explicit copy and move constructors are rare beasts, and the ripple effect of this fix was far more difficult to contain than simply saying such types do not satisfy the MoveConstructible and CopyConstructible requirements.
